result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy L LaPalm was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy L LaPalm

records.addlTxt: Returned Mail-Notice Intent Debt to WI Department of Revenue

Defendant Jeremy L. LaPalm in court, in custody.  DA Karl Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Courtney Christine Jolin in court for Jeremy L. LaPalm.  Count 1 and 2: Plea of no contest.  Plea questionnaire filed.  Rights given.  Court finds that defendant is knowingly and voluntarily waiving right to jury trial and plea is found to be entered knowingly and voluntarily.  Found guilty.   Court withholds sentence and orders 1 year probation on count 1 and 2 years probation on count 2 with conditions: AODA assessment and follow through with any counseling or treatment deemed appropriate by agent, Any other counseling deemed appropriate by agents, Maintain full time employment and/or schooling, Court costs of $443 on count 1 and $518 on count 2, due to the COC within 60 days. 125 days credit in the event of revocation.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 11, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant appears by video in the Vilas County Jail with Attorney Jolin appearing in court. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. State files information in court and provides copies to defense.  Defense waives reading of information.  Not guilty plea entered by court.  Bond continued. Court sets pre-trial for March 8th at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant appears by video in the Vilas County Jail with Attorney Jolin. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Waiver of preliminary hearing.  Rights given.  Court finds defendant is making a knowing and voluntary waiver of right to preliminary examination.  Court finds probable cause.  Bound over for arraignment on an information.  State files information in court and provides copies to defense.  Defense waives reading of information.  Not guilty plea entered by court.  Bond continued. Parties waive the Courts conflict. Court accepts waivers. Court sets arraignment hearing for January 24th at 1:30pm. bond continued.

Attorney Jolin waives reading and asks for preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and sets preliminary hearing for January 19th at 9:30 am.

Defendant appears by video in the Vilas County Jail without counsel. ADA Niemi appears in court or the State of Wisconsin. Court finds probable cause. Court sets $2000.00 cash bond. Conditions, Maintain absolute sobriety no contact with Allison Parnewicz, no contact with Antonio Papa and no contact with the residence of 3483 Birchwood Rd. Court adjourns initial appearance to January 10th at 10:00 am.
